name: Patches
description:
Title:  Patches
size:  7x10"
Medium:  oil on canvas board
Date:  Nov. 2013

name: Koji
description:
A friend of mine has a cat named Koji.  I enjoy painting animals, especially cats.  So when I hear that someone loves their pet, I have the urge to paint it.  I wanted  the painting to be as playful and colorful as their personality.

~

Title: ‘Koji'
Size:  9x12
Medium:  oil on paper
Date:  August 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Purple Darksky
description:
Painted outside my Danshui studio, just as when it was getting very dark, I knew this was going to be a mood peice of art.  Purple used to be a hard color to control, but since using different reds, it helped me expand my knowledge of purples.  I added touches of oranges and lights in the distance, plus a small boat.

~

Title: ‘Purple Darksky'
Size:  8x8"
Medium:  oil on canvas
Date:  October 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Watcher of the Danshui Sky
description:
This painting represents when I first moved  to Danshui, and my first impression were the great river views from my studio.  And I love sunsets.  Together, I can't lose.  This was the first painting in my new place.  I was pleased with the results, I never get tired of painting sunsets.

~

Title: ‘Watcher of the Danshui Sky'
Size:  25x33cm.
Medium:  oil on board
Date:  October 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Old MacKay Cafe
description:
This painting represents a special moment, as it's not only an old historic hospital, but a great little cafe with a European flavor.  It's also next to a church and I painted this outdoors, where it was my first time painting outdoors in Danshui.  There was a wedding nearby and met with locals, so it's not surprising this painting has a romantic vibe to it.

~

Title: ‘Old MacKay Cafe'
Size:  8x8
Medium:  oil on canvas
Date:  October 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Octsunset
description:
Going for the simplicity of the moment is most important to me.  I wanted a more "atmospheric" painting without much else.  I also associate orange with October.  Just pure emotion and color outside my studio window.

~

Title: ‘Octsunset'
Size:  25x33cm.
Medium:  oil on board
Date:  October 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Talking to Sunlight
description:
Capturing a sunset is a decisive moment.  The next moment it all changes.  So I painted that moment, it was because I was asking myself "What is the scene saying to me?"  This is the result.  Poetry on the river!

~

Title: ‘Talking to Sunlight'
Size:  8x8
Medium:  oil on canvas
Date:  October 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Misty Danshui Mountain
description:
I painted this iconic mountain by the Danshui river in Danshui, Taiwan.  I got out of the studio with my easel and painted the whole thing right there.  As a bonus, a steamboat passed by so I quickly put that in too. To paint this quick, you must keep everything simple.

~

Title: ‘Misty Danshui Mountain'
Size:  8x8"
Medium:  oil on canvas
Date:  October 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Gazebo's Glow
description:
I started this piece in public at Peace Park, Taipei.  I wanted to do the whole thing in one afternoon, but quickly found out it wasn't possible.  So I brought it home wet on the MRT and finished 4 days later in my studio.  I wasn't sure whether to make the foreground look like water or just an earthy ground.  So I made both.

~

Title: ‘Gazebo's Glow'
Size:  21x29"
Medium:  oil on linen canvas
Date:  October 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Botanical Temple (National museum of Taiwan History)
description:
I started this painting at the Taipei Botanical Gardens during a public outing, and I just wanted to focus on a part of the complex.  The texture came later, as I reworked it in my studio.  I'm more concerned about the essence than trying to paint all the details.  I tend to go from abstraction to realism quite a bit.

~

Title: ‘Botanical Museum'
Size:  25x33cm.
Medium:  oil on board
Date:  Aug-Oct 2013

Shipping:  Express

description:

oil on canvas board
©Joshua Lance

name: Before the Storm
description:
'Before the storm'
7x10 in.
oil on board
©Joshua Lance

name: Contemplation with Flowers
description:
I started this painting at "Exposure" art show last June and finished in my studio soon after.  This is a friend of mine who sent me a photo, I'm glad she approved (of the painting).  This was a challenging composition and wanted the facial features very accurate.  But the essence and feeling is still most important.


'Contemplation with Flowers'
oil on canvas board
31.5 x 41 cm
©Joshua Lance

name: Taipei 101 Sunrise
description:
I barely slept last night. Many wild thoughts and mind on overload. I don’t know if it was because of a super full moon, my birthday or my desire to paint. I fortunately live high up with lots of windows and for the first time, I got to witness a sunrise here in Taipei. It started with an orange/pinkish sky and then a big red ball appeared from the skyline below and began its ascent. I had to capture it quickly because the sky changes color so quickly, you have to be decisive and a bit aggressive with your paint selection. I used a very limited palette too, a warm and cool red, a yellow and a blue. A short time later, I have this painting.

~

Title: ‘Taipei 101 Sunrise’ 
Size: 8x8"
Medium: oil on board 
Date: June-Oct 2013

name: Tea Ceremony and Friends
description:
During my trip to Kyoto last year, I attended a real tea ceremony at a temple.  The items I have painted include green tea, wafers on a board, and a crock pot with rice.  All on a hardwood floor.  The colors really sing in this because I used painted with fewest strokes for the best untainted colors.

I painted on a red background to have the red and heat come through.  I love using red to highlight colors, especially greens.


~

Title: ‘Tea Ceremony and Friends’ 
Size: 8.75x10.5 in. 
Medium: oil on canvas board 
Date: June 2013

name: Walking in Jiufen
description:
One of the great pleasures of being a new resident of an old country is that every place you go seems fresh and alive.  Especially with this little mountain town by the coast called Jiufen.  It's a village about 1000 residents, an hour northeast of Taipei where old buildings, shrines and temples are authentically diverse and lovely.  

I painted this scene from a photograph in one of the alleys.  They were very cool to be in this, it reminded me a bit of Japan.  That's because this used to be a huge Japanese village when it was under control by Japan in the early 20th century.  Much of its style and relics remain intact.  I wanted to capture the energy of the scene.  For the first time, I painted figures in the painting.  I just wanted some human presence there, as humans were part of the scene as well.  I painted three kinds of reds in this painting, as I'm loving the reds in my work. 

~

Title: ‘Walking in Jiufen’ 
Size: 12.5x16 
Medium: oil on canvas board 
Date: May 2013

name: Better Days Ahead
description:
This scene was painted outside my window high enough to see the oranges of the sunset in central Taiwan.  I've always enjoyed painting sunsets, as I call them "God's Light Show."

~

Title: ‘Better Days Ahead'
Size:  7x10
Medium:  oil on board
Date:  March 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Nantou Country Homes
description:
This was a scene taken from my apartment window.  In the distance, there were a few homes I focused on.  I loved the unusual colors and textures, kind of a zen/rustic feel to it.  The mountains are in the background.

~

Title: ‘Nantou County Homes'
Size:  7x10
Medium:  oil on board
Date:  February 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Orange Door
description:
My first painting in a local park in Nantou, Taiwan.  My focus was on the orange door and its surrounding foliage of flowers, plants and trees.  A lovely piece to start your collection.

~

Title: ‘Revelation'
Size:  9.5×13 (24x33cm)
Medium:  oil on board
Date:  February/July 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Usa in Kyoto
description:
I took a trip to Kyoto, Japan in April 2012 and it was an incredible, beautiful place.  I came across a Japanese couple with their baby in a park and had to take a picture.  They said her name was "Usa".  Really, that's her name!  She must have been about 6 months old.  I tightened my technique for the face and made looser brushstrokes for the clothes.  I was going for an emotional bond, as she was staring right at me.  

~

Title: ‘Usa in Kyoto'
Size:  8x10 (oval)
Medium:  oil on canvas board
Date:  February 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Janice
description:
This is taken from a photo of a young, beautiful Phillipino woman named Janice.  She loves to pose for pics and this is the first one that made me realize that my style in portraiture was evolving much better than I thought.  I sense a southwest connection with the colors, but an Asian flare with the brushwork.

~

Title: ‘Janice'
Size:  13x9.5
Medium:  oil on canvas board
Date:  February 2013

Shipping:  Express

name: Two Paths of Reflection
description:
Painted in 2011 at the Great American Mural Competition in Tucson, AZ.  The concept of this painting is that it's two different paintings in one, two lives in one.  My life in the eastern USA and my other life in the western USA.  Like a picture card from a deck of cards, when one image is upside-down, it takes on a different reality and seen in a different way.  I have never tried this concept on a painting before.  This happens to be my largest painting to date, only my murals are larger.

Won "Most Exotic Painting" award at the competition.

*note-painting will be shipped rolled in a tube.

~

Title: ‘Two Paths of Reflection'
Size:  60x40
Medium:  acrylic on canvas
Date:  October 2011

Shipping:  Express
